en.title: FE Making Waves in Khon Kaen Thailand! (1)
en.content:
FE's Thailand Presidential Director Jankij held an Achievers Recognition Dinner on Friday 09th January 2009 for his group in Khon Kaen, north east of Thailand. The event was a GREAT SUCCESS attended by over 1,000 FE Leaders, Members and Invited Guests. Attending the event was FE Founder CEO Paul Ting (who also visited 2 stockiest centers in Khon Kaen), PDs KC Phoon and Alex Long from Malaysia, Don Chan, Country Licensee for Thailand and many PDs from Thailand.

VIPs attending include Mr Manit Wattanasen, Governor of Khon Kaen province with his wife and Mr Senekham Vongvoralath, Deputy Director General of the Department of Industry, Laos, who is also a stockiest with FE.

The event started with an aerial display by 4 paragliders carrying flags of FE, Malaysia and Thailand. There were plenty of entertainment provided by local musicians and a comedy act from Bangkok. The children from the Khon Kaen School for the Blind performed songs and dances for the crowd. Mr Paul Ting talked about FE's success story and shared FE's vision and strategy. PD KC Phoon shared his success story and performed demonstration with the Quantum Pendant. Thai PDs Jankij, Don Chan and Ponvarut gave great motivational speeches to the enthusiastic crowd.

Dozens of new Thai Directors and Executive Directors were presented with their achievement certificates and pins on the night. During the event, FE together with PD Jankij also donated to 3 local charities.

1. Baht 100,000 to the Khon Kaen School for the Blind.
   (Baht 50,000 from FE and Baht 50,000 from Jankij).

2. Baht 80,000 to Governor's Charity Foundation.
   (Baht 50,000 from FE and Baht 30,000 from Jankij).

3. Baht 100,000 to the Southern Provinces Active Soldiers Fund.
   (Baht 50,000 from FE and Baht 50,000 from Jankij).

FE is so proud of PD Jankij for his great and tireless leadership and for showing such generosity and compassion towards the less fortunate of society!

SEE YOU ALL AT THE TOP! AHOO!! AHOO!! AHOO!!
 
< Click Here For More Photos >
